** Dinobot shifted again, his muscles tense and his temper beginning to 
rise. This waiting was idiotic! The Alliance could have devised a plan to 
overthrow the Maximals by now and have carried it out right behind the 
Maximal's backs! He hated this!
Dinobot growled in a deep steady tone, his optics narrowing and glaring 
across what field was between the Alliance and himself. Though it wasn't 
long before his scanners had detected that the Alliance captives, which had 
been inside of the Cybertronian Fire, had escaped and waited at the shields 
for the Maximal commander's orders to drop them.
This was a very edgy time for everyone and he listened as a voice spoke over 
IronRaptor's communicator, telling nothing more to him then what he already 
knew. The order to drop shields...and if so done...would leave the base 
unprotected and vulnerable to enemy attack. A very complicated decision he 
would guess, as in the inner workings of the mind and as not in the actual 
answer given.
Dinobot shifted again. He needed something to do. It wasn't fair to have the 
enemy so close and not be able to slag them as he so much desired. For their 
mech-fluid to spill onto the ground as his already had once that day. 
However, he waited.**
